revised_title: The Cellular Mechanisms and Functions of Metazoan Cell Crawling
tldr: This article discusses the crawling movement of metazoan cells, focusing on the fibroblast cell type. It explains the role of adhesions, the actin-myosin system, and the dynamics of cell movement. The author outlines the machinery of cell crawling, the force-generating process, and the functions of cell locomotion in various organisms.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cell Biology
